meanings.definition: A small, upright column in a structure.
meanings.sent1: The ancient building had intricate columels supporting its roof.
meanings.sent2: The architect included decorative columels in the design of the building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel climbed the columels of the garden fence.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas stood tall like sturdy columels in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The columels of the bridge resembled tiny soldiers standing at attention.

meanings.definition: The central axis of a plant ovule.
meanings.sent1: The biologist studied the columels of the plant ovule under a microscope.
meanings.sent2: The columels play a crucial role in the development of the seed.
meanings.sent3: The tiny caterpillar used the columels as a hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the columels that drove her growth.
meanings.sent5: The columels of the ovule resembled a miniature tree trunk.

meanings.definition: A small, rounded protuberance on a mushroom cap.
meanings.sent1: The chef carefully sliced off the columels before cooking the mushrooms.
meanings.sent2: The columels of the mushroom added texture to the dish.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gnome used the columels as stepping stones.
meanings.sent4: The columels on the mushroom cap looked like tiny buttons.
meanings.sent5: The columels of the mushroom cap felt like little bumps under her fingers.
